headline: Inflation rises to 11.2% in producer index, highest on record
author: Zachary Halaschak
sentences: Producer prices increased a scorching 11.2% for the year ending in March, according to a report Wednesday from the Bureau of Labor Statistics, the highest on record.
The inflation rate in Wednesday’s producer price index report was up 1.4 percentage points from the previous month and is the highest in the gauge’s 11-year history.

The news came just a day after a report for the month of March found consumer prices increased by 8.5% —
Comments:
And it's all Putin's fault.
The producer price index gauges the wholesale prices of goods, which are eventually passed down to consumers.
Wednesday’s news signals more inflationary pain to come for households.
